div1.head: Newspaper article: “Belroi” to Be Restored, Medical News, [May 7, 1927]
div1.p:
“Belroi” to Be Restored.--The Walter Reed Memorial
Commission has authorized the appointment of chairmen in
various sections of the state to raise $2,500 for the restora-
tion of Belroi, the
birthplace of Dr. Wal-
ter Reed in Gloucester
County. The Medical
Society of Virginia
at its last annual meet-
ing appropriated funds
to purchase Belroi, to
be presented to the
commission, and the
deed has now been
properly transferred.
Major Reed was in
charge of the U. S.
Army Commission which proved that mosquitoes transmit
yellow fever. The army general hospital at Washington,
D. C., is named in his honor.
